instruction: Tell me about File Naming Best Practices
output: File names should be precise as NTFS file name size has a limit of 255 characters. This is a hard limit of the system that the Storage/Compute platform uses. Any files to be transferred to Storage/Compute need to be created following this limit or they cannot be transferred.

instruction: How do I get started with RIS Services?
output: It is assumed that users will be research faculty and staff and have Wash U WUSTL Key IDs, have access to Wash U IT Networks, and have access to a departmental WorkDay Cost Center Number. With these as pre-requisites, one can request new services by creating a Service Desk Request via the RIS Service Desk.

instruction: Can I access RIS compute services off campus?
output: Yes, however you will need to use a VPN to access compute1. Head over to https://it.wustl.edu/items/connect/ for further instructions.

instruction: Can I use RIS compute services from outside campus?
output: Yes, however you will need to use a VPN to access compute1. Head over to https://it.wustl.edu/items/connect/ for further instructions.

instruction: Am I able to use RIS compute services when not on campus?
output: Yes, however you will need to use a VPN to access compute1. Head over to https://it.wustl.edu/items/connect/ for further instructions.

instruction: Can RIS compute services be accessed from a location other than campus?
output: Yes, however you will need to use a VPN to access compute1. Head over to https://it.wustl.edu/items/connect/ for further instructions.

instruction: How do I login to RIS compute services?
output: The compute service uses the SSH protocol to one of several numbered access points with names like compute1-client-N, where N is a number. The first portion of the name, compute1, is the name of the cluster. At the time of this writing, there is one compute cluster named compute1, but there are likely to be more in the future. The second portion of the name, client-1 is the first client in the cluster. There are currently 4 clients on compute1, client-1, client-2, client-3, client-4. You can use SSH to connect to the client host with your WUSTL Key username. Here is an example of connecting to client-1: ssh wustlkey@compute1-client-1.ris.wustl.edu

instruction: After logging in to RIS compute services, how do I confirm my home directory?
output: Users are represented by WashU WUSTL Key IDs. Upon first login to a compute1-client host, the system will create a new home directory for you. From the command line, you can run the following command to confirm your home directory: echo $HOME.
